The affine version of Desargue's theorem: If two triangles $\Delta\,ABC$ and $\Delta\,RST$ are in similarity position, i.e., $g(AB)\,\|g(RS),\ g(BC)\|g(ST)$ and $g(AC)\|g(RT)$, then $g(AR), g(BS)$ and $g(CT)$ pass through a common point (or are parallel).
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
